members.member:
Centrifuge device.
The centrifuge device is a single device representing exactly one logical module on a sias instrument.
\ingroup Dev_Centrifuge
The interface includes - configuration properties for default speeds and ramps - configuration properties for the number of park and park slot positions - layout properties for the centrifuge slots - properties for the last known or actual positions - methods for moving, stopping and parking the centrifuge .
The centrifuge device is an accessible device (\b see \ref AccessibleDevices). That means it has members which can be accessed by other components. Therefore it implements methods for managing the access to this members. The centrifuge device expects a connected CAN device implementing the centrifuge module interface messages as - \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_Init}: Init %Centrifuge - \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_TimeMove}: Start %centrifugation - \nlink{Sias::CanDev::SCanMsg,CanMsg_SetGates}: Open %centrifuge cover .
%SCentrifugeDevice class diagram
\image html "SCentrifugeDevice.png"
TODO: Implement and document access mode dependent device display modes (Visualizations)

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.GetErrorInfos
member.summary: This interface function returns the default error messages which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.HandleModuleError(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: This method handles the module errors of SCentrifuge devices.
member.details: Possible Module types: - 0x0048 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_CENTRIFUGE") "old" Centrifuge (Ixion) - 0x0049 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST "MT_ICB_CENTRIFUGE") "new" Centrifuge (Ixion) . Handled errors: - 0x02 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_MOVE_ERROR") - 0x40 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_GSENS_ERROR") - 0x41 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_COVER_ERROR") - 0x42 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_COVER_ERROR1") - 0x43 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_PARK_ERROR") - 0x44 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_GSENS_ERROR1") - 0x45 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_MSWITCH_ERR1") - 0x46 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_MSWITCH_ERR2") - 0xF2 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_ERROR_CONST "ME_BUF_OVERFLOW") .
member.param: true to force the handler to handle the error

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.GetSlotIndex(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the index of the object if found in the centrifuge slot list or -1 if not.
member.returns: Index of the object, -1 if not found

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.StartTimeMove(System.UInt16,System.Int16,System.UInt16)
member.summary:
Start centrifuge command.
This command starts the centrifuge.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: ActionLockTimeout

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice._Gates
member.summary: Gate map based on last Gate access command (CloseCover/OpenCover*)

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.GateMap(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate gate map from park index.
member.returns: Gate map for the defined park index

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ParkIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate park index from slot index.
member.returns: Park index of given slot index

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.IsSlotAccessible(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Calculate whether a slot is accessible or not.
Returns is a slot is accessible based on the slot index and the gate map. Take care: This is only working, if the covers will be opened and closed using the centrifuge CloseCover/OpenCover* members.
member.returns: TRUE if the slot is accessible else false

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.CloseCover
member.summary: Close centrifuge cover.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.OpenCoverAtParkIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Open cover at the given park index.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.OpenCoverForSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Open cover for the defined slot.
member.param: Index of the slot to be accessed

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ActualLayoutDevice
member.summary: Actual layout device. E.g. for sending the display state to layout

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.AttachLayoutData(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ILayoutDevice)
member.summary:
Attach layout data.
This method tries to attach the layout data found at the given layout device to the device. If this succeeds it returns true. If it fails it returns false. In this case the calling method should retry until it finds a fitting layout device.
member.param: The layout device to attach or null to unattach an attached layout device.
member.returns: true if attachable, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.GetAccessMode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get Access mode. This Method is used to request the actual access mode.
member.returns: Access mode for the given caller object

member.name: M:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.SetAccessMode(System.Object,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SAccessMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set access mode. This method prepares the Centrifuge module to allow the requested access.
member.remarks: Remarks: - If the timeout is longer than the remaining Centrifuge time the function will not wait for the finished timeout. It returns inaccessible immediately

member.name: T:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes
member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::Centrifuge::SCentrifugeDevice errors.

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.MoveError
member.summary: 0x1302: Centrifuge movement error.\n Possible Reasons: - The speed is outside the allowed speed range for more then the defined speed error timeout - The centrifuge did not move at all (checked at the end of the movement)

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.InballaceError
member.summary: 0x1340: G-Sensor activation while movement (inballance)

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.UnexpectedCoverLockOpen
member.summary: 0x1341: The cover lock sensor gets activated while movement

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.CoverOrLockMoveError
member.summary: 0x1342: Cover or cover lock movement error.\n Possible Reasons: - The cover does not reach its position within 500 ms while the cover lock is not open - The cover lock does not reach its position within 500 ms while the cover is not closed - The cover does not close within the defined cover timeout

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.ParkingError
member.summary: 0x1343: Unable to find park position.\n Possible Reasons: - too much park retries (at old park mode) - more then 120 hall sensor changes while parking - more then 1 second without hall sensor change (motor blocked) (V0.40 or higher only)

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.GSensorError
member.summary: 0x1344: G-Sensor test failed. The G-Sensor did not get activated by the G-Sensor test unit.

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.SecuritySwitchOpenError
member.summary: 0x1345: The security switch does not open although the cover lock is open for more then the security switch open timeout (10 s).

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.SecuritySwitchCloseError
member.summary: 0x1346: The security switch does not close although the cover lock is closed.

member.name: F:Sias.Centrifuge.SCentrifugeDevice.ErrorCodes.RS232BufferOverflow
member.summary: 0x13F2: Unable to store command coming from the RS232 interface into the command buffer (hamilton protocol usage only)
